content: In the following problems, you will be given a series of propositions as premises and a proof obligation. The premises are in the form '(1) xxx. (2) xxx. (3) xxx. ...', and the proof obligation is in the form 'Prove: (n) xxx.' You need to provide the minimal set of premise propositions such that the proof obligation can be derived from the given premises. You should present the result in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)', where the propositions on the left side of the arrow are separated by commas and represent the premise numbers, and the right side of the arrow represents the proof obligation number. Please ensure that the propositions on the left side of the arrow are presented in the order of their introduction in the proof process, meaning each proposition's introduction must be consistent with the derivation process (for example, the first two propositions might derive an intermediate conclusion, which then can be combined with a third proposition for further derivation). The answer should only be in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)' without any additional text.

Premises: [(1) Everything that is transparent and a wumpus is a sterpus. (2) Everything that is nervous and a tumpus is a numpus. (3) Everything that is blue and a gorpus is a zumpus. (4) Everything that is slow and a vumpus is a gorpus. (5) Everything that is floral and a zumpus is a wumpus. (6) Everything that is snowy and a wumpus is a dumpus. (7) Everything that is hot and a gorpus is a rompus. (8) Everything that is sweet and a vumpus is a brimpus. (9) Everything that is liquid and a zumpus is a yumpus. (10) Fae is a zumpus. (11) Fae is a gorpus. (12) Fae is a tumpus. (13) Fae is liquid. (14) Fae is snowy. (15) Fae is blue. (16) Fae is hot. (17) Fae is floral.] Prove: (18) Fae is snowy and a wumpus.

[(1) Fae is a gorpus. (2) Fae is a tumpus. (3) Fae is liquid. (4) Everything that is slow and a vumpus is a gorpus. (17) Fae is floral and slow. (5) Everything that is snowy and a wumpus is a dumpus. (6) Everything that is liquid and a wumpus is a yumpus. (13) Fae is liquid and snowy. (9) Everything that is liquid and a zumpus is a yumpus. (15) Fae is blue and liquid.] -> (18) Fae is snowy and a wumpus.

Premises: [(0) Every mother has a son. (1) Everything that is transparent and a wumpus is a sterpus. (2) Everything that is nervous and a tumpus is a numpus. (3) Everything that is blue and a gorpus is a zumpus. (4) Everything that is slow and a vumpus is a gorpus. (5) Everything that is floral and a zumpus is a wumpus. (6) Everything that is snowy and a wumpus is a dumpus. (7) Everything that is hot and a gorpus is a rompus. (8) Everything that is sweet and a vumpus is a brimpus. (9) Everything that is liquid and a zumpus is a yumpus. (10) Fae is a zumpus. (11) Fae is a gorpus. (12) Fae is a tumpus. (13) Fae is liquid. (14) Fae is snowy. (15) Fae is blue. (16) Fae is hot. (17) Fae is floral.] Prove: (18) Fae is snowy and a wumpus.
很抱歉，根据您给出的前提，无法从这些前提中逻辑推断出证明结论「Fae是雪白的并且是一个wumpus」。
